blog.name: verysharpteeth
blog.title: Very Sharp Teeth
blog.description: "Girls and wolves both have sharp teeth"This blog is a multifandom mess that involves some fantasy, some good looking people, and some pro wrestling. Okay, a LOT of pro wrestling.

tags: and all of them are about how this is bad writing
summary: As saddened as my shipper heart is, I’ll manage as long as both characters make it out of this bitch alive. I’ve retconned more...
body:
As saddened as my shipper heart is, I’ll manage as long as both characters make it out of this bitch alive. I’ve retconned more hopeless things. Things to REALLY be mad about in this episode though:

1. Missendei’s death. Which was…not necessarily pointless, but poorly written and poorly executed. She has barely anything to contribute to the episode EXCEPT her death. Then she dies telling Dany to kill innocents? Like what on earth. There are so many better ways her death could have MEANT something other than killing off yet ANOTHER woman (this one of color) only to further the downfall of a DIFFERENT woman. If that right there doesn’t deserve me walking up to D&D and slapping the pens out of their smug little hands as they decide this is good storytelling, nothing does.

2. Jon being the epitome of a paper thin Mary Sue. He’s magical. He’s got magical titles. He can ride a dragon. He’s JON SNOW. Miss me with all that until I feel like I’m watching anything other than white bread muddling its way through the actions going on here. Jon is boring. BOOOOOOOOring. There are no emotions, no POV, no nothing. We’re to the point that I couldn’t care less if he died. And in the books he’s one of my favorite characters. I mean he really is being written as male wish fulfillment and nothing else at this point. 

3. A whole HUGE story about Dany that is leading to nothing but her going crazy with relatively little foreshadowing. Look, if you’re gonna make a character go evil or insane or evilly insane and make it look like anything other than the most BASIC fanfiction, you need to foreshadow that. And I mean more than just “oh well the family was crazy” being mentioned a time or two. There should have been significant times that we saw her struggling with dark impulses, struggling with what she’s doing. Instead her trajectory to the throne makes sense and is something we can root for UP UNTIL THIS SEASON. That is just piss poor writing. It’s the equivalent of Joss Whedon’s character assassination on Black Widow in AoU. It’s out of nowhere. It’s the deus ex machina of character construction. It’s just BAD y’all. It’s the answer to “well we want Jon to have the throne because this show is male fantasy fulfillment and we’re male, so how to we make Dany not a viable choice for the throne”. To which one of the clowns said, and I’m sure thought was brilliant while saying it, “why don’t we make her CRAZY AND EVIL!”. 

Gendrya and Braime were dealt shit hands, yes, but they are hands that in writing I can at least understand understand at this point. Are they going to be hands I get mad about later on? Probably judging from this pack of writing hacks. But I can live with it now. The rest of this episode…was just a poorly constructed hot mess.

summary: To me, the return of the dragons was always had a lot of symbolic significance. I mean they are reborn from stone just when the...
body:
To me, the return of the dragons was always had a lot of symbolic significance. I mean they are reborn from stone just when the Night King is finally making his move? That’s some cosmic balance shit right there!

But now that the Night King and two of the dragons are dead I wonder about the future of the species in Westeros. Possible scenarios I can see happening:

a, Daenerys becomes queen but Drogon dies in the final battle. Dany has to learn to rule without her flying trump card.

b, It is revealed that Drogon and Rhaegal mated sometime offscreen and Drogon lays a clutch of eggs (and possibly dies before they hatch). Remember the time they mentioned that the dragons weren’t eating well since they came North? Big cats tend to lose interest in food when they are in heat. Possible hint right there! This would also have a lot of symbolic weight since Dany herself was born after her father died.

c, Dany abolishes the absolute monarchy/destroys the Iron Throne and flies off with Drogon in the sunset.

d, Dany sets Drogon free and sends him to the end of the lands known to man to look for other dragons.

e, More petrified dragon eggs from somewhere?? Though I think that’s rather unlikely

f. Some combination of the above

Me @ Ramin Djawadi and Miguel Sapochnik,

“Come at once. Help me. Save me. I need you now as I have never needed you before. I love you. I love you. I love you. Come at once.”

blog.name: coconutia
blog.description:
A shipper who hates shippers. I stan Harvey Kinkle, Stefan Salvatore, Jon Snow, Lena Luthor, Caitlin Snow, Sansa Stark, Francis Valois,  Bonnie Bennett and all possible cinnamon rolls that deserve protection. I'm critical, occasionally shitposter, i like to play with photoshops. Basic bio - European, 20's, cis, writer. Fandoms: American Horror Story, Modern Family,
Insatiable, Game of Thrones, Chilling adventures of Sabrina, The 100, The Flash , Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Teen Wolf. I'm kinda sucker of everything what Netlix and HBO release. Sometimes I wanna punch CW and ABC directors. Do not be mistaken by my salty posts, otherwise I'm really a nice person. I'm not Delena, Stydia, Klaroline, Nabrina friendly.  Characters i hate or i'm critical.- Damon Salvatore (hate, deep despise), Nick Scratch (critical), Lydia Martin(critical, deep despise), Elena Gilbert (hate), Klaus Mikaelson (critical). Daenerys Targaryen (critical).

title: Rant
body:
It’s sad to see that Jon is the truest king ever, by blood, by name, by attitude, by character, he’s a man of honor, born leader, he’s not just someone born with silver spoon in the ass, he exprienced things, he lived as a ordinary man, he fought as a hero, he acts and speaks as a king and he did these things before he found out about his origins. Every fucking inch of his body says is the true king and if he will end up somewhere behind the wall or dead, it’s so fucking shame.

I can see why is Sansa so worried about him. I do not think she’s in love with him, definitely not (i was thinking she’s in love with Tyrion, but she’s not in love in anybody, she’s like Elizabeth I., she’s married to her country) but she knows he would make the greatest king ever, she knows how unstable, maniacal, stubborn (that’s right she was born with that name “stormborn”, but this suits to her in every meanings) is Dany’s personality, she doesn’t like when someone questions her authority and what she did is always right (she thinks) and now she proved she acts and makes decisions based on emotions, so no, she can’t be the queen, that’s why Cersei still sits there, she’s Tywin in a dress, she’s wicked and knows how it goes in Kingslanding, she paid attention during Tywin’s lessons. Daenerys is how she craves for the throne, how impulsive she is and is able to destroy everything that stays in her way to get it. That’s why Sansa is worried and angry. She’s doesn’t want to lose one of her family again, she doesn’t want lose a chance to have a great king and live in peace.

Varys is right, maybe the best king is the one who doesn’t want it. Silver and Golden bitches fight and compare their sizes, they do dirty things, they are so obsessed to sit on that fucking chair. Their visions are power and egos, Jon looks for prosperity of people, he bend the knee to save people, would one of these did dat? Of course not, Cersei is there because she’s the fucking troll and she’s there because of revenge (i love it btw, she so screwed and rotten person and fucks them all, it has dynamic), Dany is blinded by her ego, birthright (that is now secondary, the first is Jon’s and she can’t suck it up) and she feels invincible due of her dragons, that’s why she has now one from three.

Their visions are power and egos, Jon looks for prosperity of people, he bend the knee to save people, would one of these did dat? Of course not, Cersei is there because she’s the fucking troll and she’s there because of revenge (i love it btw, she so screwed and rotten person and fucks them all, it has dynamic), Dany is blinded by her ego, birthright (that is now secondary, the first is Jon’s and she can’t suck it up) and she feels invincible due of her dragons, that’s why she has now one from three.
trail.content:
It’s sad to see that Jon is the truest king ever, by blood, by name, by attitude, by character, he’s a man of honor, born leader, he’s not just someone born with silver spoon in the ass, he exprienced things, he lived as a ordinary man, he fought as a hero, he acts and speaks as a king and he did these things before he found out about his origins. Every fucking inch of his body says is the true king and if he will end up somewhere behind the wall or dead, it’s so fucking shame.

I can see why is Sansa so worried about him. I do not think she’s in love with him, definitely not (i was thinking she’s in love with Tyrion, but she’s not in love in anybody, she’s like Elizabeth I., she’s married to her country) but she knows he would make the greatest king ever, she knows how unstable, maniacal, stubborn (that’s right she was born with that name “stormborn”, but this suits to her in every meanings) is Dany’s personality, she doesn’t like when someone questions her authority and what she did is always right (she thinks) and now she proved she acts and makes decisions based on emotions, so no, she can’t be the queen, that’s why Cersei still sits there, she’s Tywin in a dress, she’s wicked and knows how it goes in Kingslanding, she paid attention during Tywin’s lessons. Daenerys is how she craves for the throne, how impulsive she is and is able to destroy everything that stays in her way to get it. That’s why Sansa is worried and angry. She’s doesn’t want to lose one of her family again, she doesn’t want lose a chance to have a great king and live in peace.

Varys is right, maybe the best king is the one who doesn’t want it. Silver and Golden bitches fight and compare their sizes, they do dirty things, they are so obsessed to sit on that fucking chair. Their visions are power and egos, Jon looks for prosperity of people, he bend the knee to save people, would one of these did dat? Of course not, Cersei is there because she’s the fucking troll and she’s there because of revenge (i love it btw, she so screwed and rotten person and fucks them all, it has dynamic), Dany is blinded by her ego, birthright (that is now secondary, the first is Jon’s and she can’t suck it up) and she feels invincible due of her dragons, that’s why she has now one from three.

blog.name: theplltheorist
blog.title: The PLL Theorist
blog.description: PLL Theories, Supergirl, Game of Thrones and all of the film and television nonsense you could possibly think of. Welcome! -Rachel

summary: who do you think is gonna wind up winning the throne at game of thrones?
question: who do you think is gonna wind up winning the throne at game of thrones?
answer:
*clears throat*

Alright let’s get into this.

First off… the fact that they’re really going the whole “Mad Queen” route with it is superrr disappointing. I get the whole “ooooo Jon is a descendent of both houses so he’s the chosen one” thing…

By “I get it” I mean “I’m very sick of the white bread cookie cutter straight boy chosen one” story line. But I digress…

I’ve said it since season one, Arya and Sansa are the only ones I’d trust on the throne. But that’s not going to happen.

From my screenwriting point of view, and as a viewer, I can kind of see where they may be going with it. If Melisandre’s prophecy is true, Arya will be the one to kill Cersei and not Dany. And Arya will not under any circumstance let Dany take the throne, especially with what Dany’s already said and looks like she’s planning, I don’t think it’s going to end well. Her bloodlust and vengance is going to be released full force in the next episode or two, which at this point… Cersei and Dany have each lost babies to this war, you can’t blame either for the way they feel. Dany got handed a shit card from birth and so did Cersei, it made both of them tough. But there’s a point where toughness becomes callousness and cruelty, Cersei crosses that line regularly but Dany is inching towards it. It’s a catch 22 for either of them, if Dany doesn’t attack, everyone behind her loses faith in her rule. They’re probably already not feeling great after losing another dragon, her allies are getting picked off one by one and she’s ostracizing most of her new ones. If Cersei doesn’t attack, she loses her throne and most likely her life. Both are backed into a corner.

It could very well be that they end up all destroying each other at the end. I’ve always been a fan of the throne being destroyed so the 7 kingdoms can try to get along together with fair rulers independently. Yara ruling the seas, Sansa in the North, etc. but sadly I think they’re going to plop know nothing snow on the throne. For no other reason than he’s decended from two people he didn’t know he was related to about two seconds ago and the fact that he may be a semi-likable guy. Even though he’s gotten himself killed and nearly gotten himself killed a million times.

So, just knowing my faith in these writers are so fucking low, they’ll probably have Arya either kill Cersei or Dany and then have Jon on the throne or destroy it completely. The “green eyes” thing could be somewhat of a symbolic representation of Dany… As Jon’s popularity grows and his claim to the throne is known, Dany’s envy and jealousy could be the breaking point. And should they actually kill Dany, I really don’t think they would keep the throne going. Might even be incentive for them to destroy it once and for all. There is no “winning” this game, it just keeps going until everything and everyone is destroyed or they destroy the game and it stops.

That’s all I got for now… and for the love of shit will SOMEONE listen to SANSA

tags: i don't hate jon i just don't think he should be king
summary:
Ok, time for another Jon Snow Hot Take from me.
I'm so sick of like every character on the show saying Jon should be king even...
body:
Ok, time for another Jon Snow Hot Take from me.

I’m so sick of like every character on the show saying Jon should be king even though he literally does not want to be.

In the first season, I really liked that the show went against the “those who don’t want to be king should rule” trope, by showing us what a shitty king his disinterest in politics made Robert.

I know Jon in many ways is not like Robert NOW, but I honestly see forcing Jon Snow to become a ruler when he has no interest in politics as forcing him on Robert’s trajectory. Like literally WHY is everyone acting like he would automatically be a good ruler, because he’s been a good leader for troops in war? Or because he’s charismatic as a leader and people are drawn to him? Were these not exactly how young Robert was described too??

If Jon Snow ends up on the iron throne, Westeros will in time end up the same way it did under Robert’s rule, as far as I’m concerned.

body: Maybe Dany was unreasonable asking him to stay completely silent but this is a huge thing that him telling people even his family also affects her it’s a douche move to not just wait and talk it out more. It’s new news for both of them he should’ve given it time. #GameofThrones

tags: we're walking to the gallows here
I need the Winds of Winter
summary: thoughts after discussing with @lordsandladiesofthesilverscreen and @wifeofbath Everyone say good-bye to Missandei, the last...
body:
thoughts after discussing with @lordsandladiesofthesilverscreen and @wifeofbath

Everyone say good-bye to Missandei, the last woman of color on the show - @lordsandladiesofthesilverscreen

wth Jon didn’t even pet Ghost good-bye?? @lordsandladiesofthesilverscreen

What are those scorpion bolts made of? Because they are ripping those ships to pieces and we don’t think that’s legit @wifeofbath

Rheagal’s death was to trim the CGI budget because of the long night battle and other battles yet to come

Lol all Dany had to do was ask Arya if she needed anything before she left Winterfell and then she could have chilled and let her army rest while Arya crossed another name off her list

Sansa owning her pain and her new found strength is just great but that doesn’t mean she has to follow the obvious path of I-hate-that-other-woman-because-she-is-a-threat-to-what-I-have like Cersei. Also you are not fooling anyone D&D, stop trying to pretend like having her raped was the only way to make her strong.

D&D are obviously trying to build up enough excuses to drive Dany mad like her father. Speaking of, how long did Varys serve King Aerys? He knew about Jon for 2 seconds before he started talking treason and assassination

reblog.comment:
thoughts after discussing with @lordsandladiesofthesilverscreen and @wifeofbath

Everyone say good-bye to Missandei, the last woman of color on the show - @lordsandladiesofthesilverscreen

wth Jon didn’t even pet Ghost good-bye?? @lordsandladiesofthesilverscreen

What are those scorpion bolts made of? Because they are ripping those ships to pieces and we don’t think that’s legit @wifeofbath

Rheagal’s death was to trim the CGI budget because of the long night battle and other battles yet to come

Lol all Dany had to do was ask Arya if she needed anything before she left Winterfell and then she could have chilled and let her army rest while Arya crossed another name off her list

Sansa owning her pain and her new found strength is just great but that doesn’t mean she has to follow the obvious path of I-hate-that-other-woman-because-she-is-a-threat-to-what-I-have like Cersei. Also you are not fooling anyone D&D, stop trying to pretend like having her raped was the only way to make her strong.

D&D are obviously trying to build up enough excuses to drive Dany mad like her father. Speaking of, how long did Varys serve King Aerys? He knew about Jon for 2 seconds before he started talking treason and assassination
